Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begins the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Therefore, my children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the knowledge in medicine, by completing it you will attain its end, and by reading its explanations and clarifications, I find that I should complete this treatise on surgery for you.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Since the art of surgery is almost entirely obsolete in our kingdom and time, due to the great danger it poses, and the instruments of surgery are lost; only a few small descriptions remain in the books of the ancients, which have been corrupted by many errors and hazards until their meanings are obscured and their power diminished.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	I find it appropriate to arrange this treatise according to the method of explanation and clarification and abbreviation; and so that the forms of cautery instruments and other tools of the work come with their explanations and preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	One reason for the scarcity of good craftsmen in this field is that the art of medicine requires lengthy study, and the one who practices it must have knowledge of anatomy, which includes knowing the joints and shapes of members, their connection and separation; having knowledge of bones, nerves and ligaments, and their number, and the extraction of them; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the locations for their incision.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And as Hippocrates said, a word is a small thing in itself, but it has great significance in work and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	And we have already said about this in the introduction of this book; whoever is not well-versed in anatomy is not qualified to avoid falling into error, which can lead to the death of men, as I have seen many of these people, some are ignorant of this science and abandon it after their learning and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I saw a foolish and experienced doctor make an abscess called scrophulus on the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries in her neck so that a large amount of blood flowed until the woman died among them.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I also saw another doctor who believed he could pull out a stone from a man in his condition, and the stone was large, and it came to him and cut a piece of the bladder while pulling out the stone, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I have already stated that this is the case, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, it was clear that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	I also saw another doctor who received a salary from a duke of our land to perform surgery, and he went to a black castellan who was owed a fracture in his thigh; and the doctor prepared himself with his ignorance, extracted the fracture, on the wound, with pulvines and splints of strong construction, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	He laid it open as desired, and he applied the dressing, and he left it to heal for several days and commanded us to remove the bandages; and so it was until the thigh and leg became abscessed, and this led to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you are called upon to him, and prepare to unbind the liniment, and peace and quiet is obtained, and he may then alleviate his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, corruption had already spread in the limb, so it could not be restrained, and the corruption continued to spread through the limb until the patient was at risk.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And another doctor pierced an abscess full of cancer, and it became an ulcer close to several days, until the evil within it was magnified by its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the cancerous growth is pure of melancholy humor, and therefore it should not come upon him with all ferocity, but rather on an organ or member that is most vulnerable to it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my son, it is necessary that the operation be divided into two parts: one part is the operation associated with health, and the other part is the operation in which danger lies in greater decisions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already examined this matter in every place of this book where the operation is carried out with error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard against this and let go of that, so that foolish people do not find a way to speak and mislead you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take your weapons with caution and the protection of God, and your patients with compassion and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way for the grace of God to be lost in salvation and a blessed succession, and set aside the terrible diseases that are difficult to heal, and lay down your weapons from that which causes you fear, so that examination in your faith and in your name does not cause you to be led astray: for it remains with your glory, and moreover in this world and in the next to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualla now says in some of her teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not treat an evil disease, so that bad doctors do not become known."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and it starts with the first chapter of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is arranged for the foot, regarding the shapes of instruments and the fire of cauteries, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter is about cysts and piercing, wounds, sores, extraction of bladders and similar things, all arranged in the shapes of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter is about restoration and dislocation, and treatment of twisting and similar things, arranged for the foot, and in the shapes of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauteries with fire and sharp medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	That is where the treatment of the entire book begins.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary that I speak about the quality of the juxtaposition of the cautery and its negative effects, and in what circumstances cauterization should be prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech about the quality of the juxtaposition of the cautery and its negative effects is a long, detailed, subtle discourse full of science, hidden secrets; and many wise people have already spoken at length about it, and they disagree, and to me it amounts to only a small part of their discourses, fearing prolixity.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that the use of cauterization applies universally to all matters or substances, with two exceptions, which are situations without matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the situation without matter and dry, there is disagreement; for some say that cauterization is beneficial in this case, while others say the opposite, that cauterization is not suitable for a disease that is due to quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is appropriate that a dry and desiccated disease be treated with wet things.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And I say that he who says the opposite is correct, that cauterization is beneficial in all dry and desiccated diseases that occur in the bodies of men, because when you compare the bodies of men and their humidity to the nature of fire, the bodies of men are burned by it.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say from experience that this has been observed in some cases by me.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not necessary to reiterate that which has already been expounded and exercised in the chapter on cauterization by previous exercise, and to know the diversity of human bodies and the disposition of diseases in their bodies, and the causes of these diseases, and the accidents associated with them, and the time span of these conditions.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	However, in other situations, there is no need for fear, and especially in wet and cold diseases, because all doctors agree on these, and there is no disagreement about the beneficial effects of cauterization in these cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you, my sons, know that the secret of healing by cauterization with fire and the goodness of it is that cauterization with burning medicine is superior to cauterization with fire, because fire is simple, its action does not extend beyond the member being cauterized and is harmful only to a small extent to neighboring members.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of burning medicine extends to adjacent members, and it has a strong effect in bringing disease to the diseased member that is difficult to heal and causes pain.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, because of its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does not do this, except that it superfluesc. It is already known to us by experience and by the length of service in the study of the art concerning the truth of the causes; and because of that, I am excused from the length of the sermon. If it were not forbidden in my free speech here, I would reveal secretly hidden about fire, and the quality of the operation in the bodies and its expulsion through which diseases are expelled, philosophical demonstrative discourse, which sharpens your thoughts.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	Know, sons, that they disagree about the time in which it is appropriate to perform cautery and pause the best time of springtime.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cautery is appropriate at all times, because the harm due to accidental time is submerged in the benefit of what is drawn from cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pain or necessary pain, which do not tolerate delay, since it is feared that the harm coming from malicious intent, which is greater than small harm entering through time, could overcome it.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Do not believe in your thoughts, or sons, that it is not considered except by the common people and foolish doctors, because reduction of that disease which is cured by cautery is not complete at all times, and they pause on this consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as they believe, because cautery is not simply in a place of medicine that alters the complexion and dries up the humidities that are the cause of pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But indeed, cautery surpasses medicine due to the desire for its value and virtue in its operation and the greatness of its Lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the disease will return at some hour of time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of the disease, as well as its power, and what is prepared in his body from accumulations in him of superfluities and humidities, and what is obtained for him in food and similar things from these causes; except that the disease in which cautery is administered is a subtle disease in a member with few superfluities and humidities, such as cautionery on teeth for pain, it is possible that the pain will not return there, but rather it is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	But the common saying is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and this is an incorrect saying, not according to what I understand in it, because I believe that it is not a cure that improves with medicine or any other reason for cautionery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is opposite of that; and my intention that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is not because it is administered in some diseases when methods of healing do not confer, but rather at the end of the disease, cautionery is administered and improves upon it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	Now you understand that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the intention that I understand from the common people and the follies of foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	They said the ancients that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	They said that the location of cautery does not harm, as this is not absolutely true, because I already have it proven and observed that it does not do so in some bodies, and cauterizing with gold is better than with iron as they say; however, when you perform cauterization with fire from gold, it is not declared to you, because it depends on the quantity that you want according to the roughness of gold, and it prepares to receive cold; and if you adjust it above the fire, the gold melts due to heat, and if some layers occur in the fire for the craftsman to cut through the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And because of this, cautery with iron must be done lightly and more carefully in terms of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have arranged this chapter on cautery according to the chapters, and I have ordered those of the head within the feet, so that I alleviate your request for what you want from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cauterizing pain in the head due to cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers upon coldness and humidity the harmful accident of which there are two causes, namely scrofula and an abundance of rheumatic fluxes, called corrosion, from the head to the parts of the ears and eyelids flowing, and an abundance of sleeping, and tooth pain and hoarseness, and universally on all disease that comes due to coldness, such as paralysis, scurvy, apoplexy, and similar things in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, you command the patient to be evacuated with a laxative medicine, cleansing his head for three or four nights, according to the power of the patient and his age and his custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and position it so that you sit on top of it between your hands on a sloping bench and hold his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the edge of your palm in line with the base of the nose between his eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But indeed, as your hand position has been reached, mark that location with a test and then ignite the olive oil cautery, which is the form of this.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And place a cushion on the spot indicated, in such a manner that it descends, with which your hand should be gently constrained little by little, and you turn it over.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And lift your hand slightly and look at the spot, if you see any part of the bone exposed, such as a small amount of gravel, then raise your hand, and if it does not return to that position, use another tool, if it is cold, until the bone that I told you about is seen.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And take a small amount of salt and dissolve it in water at that spot, let it remain for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place a cushion over the sore wound and leave it until the scar from the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And treat the area with a strong four-ingredient medicine until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	They say that when the wound remains open, it gets better by applying honey, because it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	They say that some of them should have the callous burned to the bone with a cautery and keep the cautery on it until some part of the bone has been burned away.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And shave that which is next to the bone and treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Others say that with the cautery you can reach the marrow, until it causes deep pain in the bone, and this is the method of amputation in small cases.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that from that spot the vapors of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	Keep the wound open for a long time and treat it until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	Moreover, I have not seen these two types of cauterization in every case, only in some men out of fear; and leave that one alone, for it is better for your health when you do so, because the head is exposed due to a continuous solution of such things as we have testified in other members, and especially if the patient's head is naturally frail.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The primary type of cauterization is safer and better for your health, and from that moment on, use it for your health.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Two.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When a chronic and long-lasting pain occurs throughout the entire head in the patient and it is prolonged, and he uses medications such as headaches, migraines, head wraps, and capillary treatments, ointments, poultices, balms, oils, liniments, and similar remedies, especially if it has already been cauterized with one cautery that has not helped in any of those ways, then consider whether the patient's head is naturally strong; and if it is not frail and weak, perform another cauterization using a different cautery.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And cauterize that part of the head near the ear with cauterization until the callous is separated.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the callous and expose the bone in the quantity that has been determined and cauterize it at the back of the head in the place called "Venus," - which is the location where a blister is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And be careful not to expose the bone because the patient will experience great pain different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will tell you where this cauterization should be performed, because the cauterization in which the corn of the head and the occiput is cauterized is more subtle than the one used for cauterizing other parts of the head; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Chapter Three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Treatise on modern cautery (or Cauterization in Modern Times)
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain in the head occurs or pain penetrates into the skull, or pain settles in the neck, it should be treated with medications that heal the head, and the other remedy, which I have mentioned in the treatments for diseases; but if this does not help, then cauterization is required in two ways: either cauterization with acute burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Moreover, burning with a hot iron requires that you take a ladle of lime, scrape it and remove its edges on both sides from the handles.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the temple area with a scalpel that enters deeply until it is made hidden (covered up).
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then press down on the area with compressed bandages and leave it like that for three hours; then loosen the bandage and remove the lime, leaving the wound open for two or three days, and then place a dressing over the submerged area until the tissue heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then care for the wound until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you want, do this with some burning medications that I have written in the second treatise on burning medications.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, ironing cauterization according to this method: fire for the cauterizing is required. The shape of it is:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and is called a nail-like claw, because its head is shaped like a nail with a slight curve, and in the middle of it there is a small elevation.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Place your hand over the area of pain, keep your hand - so as not to be harmed by the archer's equipment that is nearby - and rotate the small iron slowly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount that is burned by the sharp edge of the scalpel is small compared to the size of it, raise your hand in such a way that the artery is not harmed, which is nearby, so that there will be no bleeding.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then immerse the area in salt water and place it over the location, leaving it for three days; then cover the area with lint, and care for the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you want, perform the cauterization with the extremity of the cutler's knife according to cautery and be careful not to make an incision in the artery during this modern gout treatment (cauterization).
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Treatise on ancient gout cauterization.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat gout with the remedies that I have previously mentioned, and the treatment does not work, or the disease is one that does not respond to the remedy for the first cauterization with medicine or fire cauterization, then it is necessary that you ignite the cautery knife until it glows, meaning placing it on the location of pain with a line of sufficient length, so that it covers the area; and after pressing your hand for a while, pierce the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, you must be careful not to damage the jawbone, which is necessary for chewing, and that the ligament is not injured and the nerves that supply it, and that there are no spasms.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the care and caution of stopping the flow of blood from an artery that is incised, for in the incision there is fear, especially for one who does not know what to do and is not skilled and experienced; leave the operation on it at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	Here comes the next sentence to translate:
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	If this illness is not alleviated by this cautery and the body of the patient tolerates it, cauterize in the middle part of the head as we have mentioned, and heal the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you find that the cautery mentioned in the section on artery obstruction with cautery having two irons is not effective, this caution is more beneficial and appropriate.
Capitol .v.	Capital V:
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Chapter on Cauterization of Ear Pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and is cured by causatives or other treatments mentioned in the division, but the pain persists, then ignite the cautery, which is called "puncture." Here is its form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Approach the "puncture" with caution and bring it near the ignition, ensuring that it surrounds the entire ear as a wheel is rolled or in the circumference of each sample if the pain is in one area.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Approach the ear cauterization slowly, taking care to locate the exact spot before proceeding.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	If multiple points of cauterization are made in the entire ear, ensure that each is properly treated until healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI:
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Chapter on Cauterization for Torticollis (Wryneck).
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Wryneck that is cured with cauterization is only done for the species that come from poison, as mentioned in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Cauterization should be avoided for the species that enter by dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	If the treatment of wryneck with herbs, capers, and gargles does not work, you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: first, make an incision in the ear, second, apply a small hot iron to the temple, and third, cauterize the junction of the lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Allow the cautery to cool in the opposite direction of the affected side, as the healing process will only occur in the healthy area.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization involves using the cautery to make an incision in the upper part of the ear near the corner of the head, and another incision along the temple, the length of which should be the same as the width of the finger used to make it. After making the incisions, allow the cautery to cool before proceeding with treatment. Ensure that the cauterization is carried out until the affected area is completely burned away.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the shape of the cautery, it is the specialized tool of the blacksmith, its shape being like a tabletop.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is more subtle than what one can see with the eyes; and it is necessary to remove any excess thickness from it.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then take care of the place with what is in front of the process before it heals.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the ancient cautery for apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you are treating it with what has been said and the patient does not have a fever, then cauterize it with four cauteries: primarily on all corners of his head; at the middle of the head, as has been said; and at the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The method of using the cautery is done as has been said before.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	It has been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; it is more recent; take care of it with what you are processing.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the cauterization for forgetfulness caused by fevers.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is necessary to give the patient at the beginning large and round pills, altering them if needed.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the patient's entire head and place on it a plaster made of the ingredients described in the treatise on plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	Leave that area uncovered for some days, as this is the method of using the cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do what that medicine orders, which I have already mentioned before.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	Therefore, if it cures well with that treatment, then there is no need for anything else; but if not, make three cauteries on the lower part of his head, decreasing from the most superior part of the head to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Leave a gap between each cautery and take care of the cauterized area with what you are processing.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you feel that the patient can tolerate more, then make a single cautery at the middle location; but if you want to be more aggressive, make it over both ears.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Take care of the cauterized area until it heals; and let the cauterization be olive-shaped, as described before.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization for preservation and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	It is necessary to process the head with what has been said and give him pills; then shave the patient's head, make a cautery at the middle of his head, a cautery over all the corners of his head, another cautery on the lower part of his body, and three cauterizations over the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the illness of softening the body due to a severe condition and the patient can tolerate it, cauterize it over the vertebrae of the back with four cauterizations, and later make a cautery at the place where the cord emerges from the spine, and raise your hand above it.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Take care of the cauterized area until it heals, and let this be olive-shaped cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not to be cauterized; rather, that epilepsy is due to a fever.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to process the brain of the patient at the beginning with what has been mentioned before and with the other treatment that I described in the division when the patient is strong and can tolerate the exception of medicine.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	If the patient is a child who cannot tolerate medications, administer powders and sweetened medicines that can be processed, with the help of purgatives for several days, with purification of food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head and make a single cautery at the middle of his head according to the previous method, another cautery on the back of his head, and one over each corner of his head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	If the patient is strong and tolerant, then cauterize that area with a cautery, having paralysis and softening of the body over the spinal column at the neck and the spinal column at the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Then use olive oil as a precursor to the cauterization.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	However, if the patient is a child, pause the subtle cauterization in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted and weakened humors, then cauterize that area with a cautery, having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess declining to melancholia, and the patient's body is moist, give him water that purifies his brain as described in the previous division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, and prepare a turtle shell properly made for him on top of his forehead, and apply it in the middle of his head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	The patient should be seated and kept from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply a lining, which is suitable for an old ewe's fleece.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	Heat that area over a fire at a moderate temperature, which the patient should endure when it is placed there.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then place it in the middle of his forehead, and leave him with it until it is cooled down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Do this to the patient every week once, along with his other treatment until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize that area by making small points as much as possible, without letting go of a cautery in such a manner: this is a type of cauterization that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	Then place that area in sheep's wool or linen cloth.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the cauterization of water flowing down the leg.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the start of water flowing down the leg according to the signs I mentioned in the previous division, begin and give the patient water that purifies his head, and keep him away from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	Apply that salt in a bath every day.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then command him to shave his head, and cauterize that area with a cautery in the middle of his forehead; and cauterize it twice with two cauteries on both temples if it is the beginning of a flow of water in both legs, or once with one cauterization if it is the beginning of water flowing in one leg.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Make incisions with a cautery on all veins and arteries that are already open; and make the cauterizations in that area near the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	Be careful to avoid bleeding when cauterizing; and if you see blood flowing from there, stop it with some medicine that is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I will come with knowledge that is in the extraction of arteries and the opening of those, as well as caution for bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	It is sometimes cauterized in the neck, just below two bones, with two cauterizations properly performed.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On the cauterization of ancient tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears in the legs are ancient and persistently, and it is determined that it is an excess of phlegmatic fluids in the areas of the head visible outside the skull and confirmed by the veins and arteries in that location, then cauterize that area with a cautery as described in the beginning of water flowing down the legs, and use a cauterization on the forehead and two cauterizations near the temples, as well as two cauterizations near the neck bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if it requires addition (meaning treatment), then cauterize the entire length of the hernia along the base of the scrotum at the eyelash tip using a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	This appears to be a reference to a chapter number in the treatise. The Roman numerals were used in medieval texts, and this one corresponds to the 14th chapter.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of nasal foul smell.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat the person you mentioned in the previous section and your treatment does not work, prepare your equipment and give the patient three nights of cochina (a type of medicinal drink) to drink; then shave their head and cauterize the area using a medium-sized cautery with an olive oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize that area with a small clove-scented cautery on both eyelids, removing the hair slightly.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn the affected area by accident.

De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cauterization for softening the eyelids of males.

E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you are cauterizing that area, make a small mark with two cauteries on both eyelids in all directions, and extend the marks to the temples.

E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cautery, but according to the third part of the eyelid that is affected.
Capitol .xvi.	Capitol .xvi. (16th chapter)
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On the cauterization of the male eyelid when the hair is converted into parts inside and pierces the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hair of the eyelid is converted into parts inside and pierces the eye in this manner, cauterization can be performed in two ways: either by burning or by using a medicine to burn.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If a pointed cautery of the foot is heated, tell the patient to read these words just as those who clean themselves do, until they are prolonged and swollen; and if you puncture it, then hold the heels with a bandage so that it is not harmed until the skin grows back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels. E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then put cotton soaked in oil or bird glue on the heel.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And heat the pointed cautery of that shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And cauterize with the pointed shape that was signaled, bit by bit, in small patches until the surface of the skin, which is like holly leaf, is burnt entirely and appears properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of the cure of your work is that the eyelids of the heel will be contracted and the skin over the heel raised due to the puncture of the heel.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Therefore lift it up and place it for three days, and have it bandaged until the scar has risen.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And cure that one with mouthwash until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if the skin returns due to some cause and the eyelid becomes soft, then do another time the cautery over it just as you did the first time.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin is in the eyelid, cauterize it until it returns to its natural position and is swollen and the skin does not touch the heel.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But if the cautery with medicine burns this one, tell the patient to read the skin until it is prolonged and swollen, and have paper or cloth in the shape of holly leaf made.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And take known sage and live coals in a cup. And mix it well. And say that, and mix those substances well, and do it quickly so that it is not spoiled; and spread that over the paper in the shape of holly leaf, and place it on one or both heels; and place a cotton soaked in oil under the heel, and the head of the patient should be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the medicine on the skin and press it gently, but do not let it be too hard because biting is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when you notice that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, then remove the medicine and let it dry; and once the biting stops, remove the medicine and wash the heel with water; and consider if the eyelid has been raised as it should be washed with fire or incision because at this point it is good; and if it does not return to its original position due to the medicine being pressed too hard or if the operation is spoiled, then put the medicine on the same spot until the heel is swollen.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And have it bandaged until the callus of the adhesion is removed, and cure that one with mouthwash or another remedy until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must keep watch over your operation to make sure that no pus from the medicine falls on the heel, and if the eyelid becomes soft after a few days and some cause of the skin touches the heel, then repeat your medicine on the spot where the eyelid has become soft, just as you did at the beginning, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the shape of holly leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	You should know that the heels of men are diverse according to their size and thickness, and therefore your treatment will depend on this.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	Do not hide the true path from the one who studies in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of fistulas that are in the heel's lacrimal gland.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat fistulas as mentioned in the division of diseases and do not confer your treatment, then it is necessary that you cauterize it in this manner: tell the patient to place their head in your lap, and have a servant hold the head of the patient in such a way that it is neither harmed nor agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And put cotton soaked in oil or bird glue on the heel of that fistula.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And heat the pointed cautery of this shape:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	The subject should be in a concave shape, similar to a reed or a pen with a bent tip, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if it penetrates into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	If you wish it to come out thus it tries.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the concave one is better for this work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press the fistula if it is open, and draw pus and dry it out from there.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the purulent material from there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place your hand on the cautery which should be well ignited, and hold it there about one finger's width below the patient's nose, so that neither you nor the patient are disturbed, and then press the cautery onto the vein and burn it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, if the cautery enters the bone at the beginning, it is good; otherwise, you should repeat the cautery one or two times, if necessary; and leave it as it is for three days, and then press on that spot with a border and cover it with an absorbent dressing until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	However, if it has passed ten days and is not healed, then press on it with a sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and scraped as needed in its respective chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another method of cauterizing a fistula, which some have said earlier: enter the location of the fistula and fill it up, then press on that fissure with a fine metal rod of the shape of a feather; It was the quantity of one inch of melted lead; hold your hand with good grip, but do not harm the patient because the melted lead should not reach the vein of that location; and you must also press on the vein of the patient's location with albumen of egg or water, for the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it miraculously.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what has been said about cauterization and cure, that is good; otherwise, it is necessary to administer a nose drop and reduce the fistula into the nostril according to its proper location.

De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Treatise on the Cauterization of Fissures in the Feet.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Swelling frequently occurs in lips, especially in those of children.

Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On cauterization of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess appears on the uvula or the palate or in the roots of teeth and you apply a bandage, and it bursts, and becomes infected, and a fistula is formed, and you treat it and its cure does not improve, then you must heat a cautery according to the amount required for the fistula, and insert the heated cautery into the hole in the fistula, keeping your hand inside until the heat reaches the base of it, and at the end do this once or twice; and apply treatment with what we have told you about its cure until it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the pus is drained and heals, that is good; otherwise, it becomes necessary to find the location and remove the corrupt bone as described in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On cauterization of teeth and softening of swellings.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When swellings are softened by moisture and teeth are damaged, and you use medicines to treat them but they do not improve, then place the patient's head on your lap, and heat the cautery according to the method that will be described next, so that you can quickly press the handle of the cautery against the tooth and insert it into the swelling, keeping your hand a little away from the tooth until the patient feels the heat of the fire reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And lift up your hand, and repeat heating the cautery several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Make the patient rinse their mouth with salty water and hold it for an hour, then spit it out, because a damaged tooth is closed and swollen gums are tightened and decaying moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On cauterization of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness, or it has rotted or worms have invaded it and cannot be cured with medicine, then cauterize in that manner according to two methods: cauterization with a cow's horn, or cauterization with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterizing with a cow's horn means that you take a horn of a cow and sharpen it with iron, wrap it in cloth, immerse the sharpened end in boiling water, and place it on the painful tooth as quickly as possible until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat the process several times until the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you prefer, immerse cotton or cloth in the horn mentioned earlier, place it on the painful tooth, and hold the heated iron over it until the iron reaches the bottom of the tooth cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterizing with fire requires careful attention to the quality of the charcoal or iron, and there should be some coarseness in it so that the heat of the fire does not burn the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And apply the chosen method of fire cauterization, place it on the tooth and hold your hand over it until the cauterization cools down; do this several times to alleviate or eliminate the pain that day or the next day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary to inform the patient that they must keep good cotton in their mouth for an hour and then spit it out; this is the method of fire cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize with whichever method you prefer.

Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema. E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.
